alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:30PM EDT until September 07 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL CLINTON...NORTHWESTERN ADDISON...SOUTHERN GRAND ISLE...CHITTENDEN AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 329 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Grand Isle to South Burlington to Weybridge, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Vergennes, Middlebury, Weybridge, Winooski, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Westford, Monkton Boro, Colchester, Essex Junction Village, Fairfax, Williston, New Haven, Georgia, Hinesburg, and St. George. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
